## Reaction Times per stimulus

```{r, reaction-times, echo=FALSE}
df <- df.production %>% select(prolific_id, id, RT) %>% group_by(id) %>%
  distinct()

dat.RT = df %>% group_by(id) %>% summarise(mu=mean(RT), sd=sd(RT), .groups="drop_last")
df <- left_join(df, dat.RT, by="id")
for(pa in seq(1,2)) {
  p <- df %>%  
    ggplot(aes(y=RT)) + geom_boxplot(outlier.shape = NA) +
    geom_jitter(aes(x=0, color=prolific_id), width = 0.1, alpha = 0.5) +
    geom_hline(aes(yintercept = mu), color="green", linetype="dashed") +
    theme(legend.position="right", axis.ticks.x = element_blank(), axis.text.x = element_blank()) +
    labs(x="", y="RT in ms", title="Reaction Times per stimulus") +
    facet_wrap_paginate(~id, nrow=2, ncol=5, page=pa) +
    scale_y_continuous(trans = log2_trans(),
                       breaks = trans_breaks("log2", function(x) 2^x),
                       labels = trans_format("log2", math_format(2^.x))) +
    theme(legend.position="none")
  print(p)
}
```

# Plot Mean of cell values of generated tables (normalized tables)
Look at mean probability ratings dependent on the utterance expected in
respective production trial. 

```{r, plot-functions, echo=FALSE}
PlotMeans <- function(df, id, by_id=FALSE) {
  df.sorted = df %>% arrange(desc(means)) %>%
    mutate(label=case_when(question=="b" ~ labels.test[["b"]], 
                           question=="g" ~ labels.test[["g"]],
                           question=="bg" ~ labels.test[["bg"]],
                           question=="none" ~ labels.test[["none"]]))
  id.levels = df.sorted %>% pull(id) %>% unique()
  df.sorted = df.sorted %>%
    mutate(id=factor(id, levels=id.levels),
                     question=factor(question, levels=questions.test, labels=labels.test))
  p <- df.sorted %>%
    ggplot(aes(x=factor(0), y=means))
  
  if(by_id){
    p <- p + geom_bar(aes(fill=id), stat="identity", position="dodge") + labs(x="")
  } else {
    p <- p + geom_bar(stat="identity") + labs(x="", title=id)
  }
  
  p <- p +
    facet_wrap(~question, nrow=2, ncol=2) +
    theme(text = element_text(size=20))
  
  print(p)
  return(p)
}
```

## Slider Ratings

```{r, prepare-exp1-data, echo=FALSE}
df.prior_responses = data.prior.norm %>%
  select(-custom_response, -QUD, -RT, -trial_number, -trial_name) %>% 
  pivot_wider(names_from = "question", values_from = "response") %>%
  add_probs()

prior_responses = df.prior_responses %>%
  pivot_longer(cols=c("b", "g", "bg", "none", starts_with("p_")),
               names_to="prob", values_to="val") %>%
  mutate(utterance=
           case_when(prob=="b" ~ standardized.sentences$b,
                     prob=="g" ~ standardized.sentences$g,
                     prob=="bg" ~ standardized.sentences$bg,
                     prob=="none" ~ standardized.sentences$none,
                     prob=="p_a" ~ "blue falls",
                     prob=="p_c" ~ "green falls",
                     prob=="p_na" ~ "blue does not fall",
                     prob=="p_nc" ~ "green does not fall",
                     prob=="p_c_given_a" ~ standardized.sentences$if_bg,
                     prob=="p_c_given_na" ~ standardized.sentences$if_nbg,
                     prob=="p_a_given_c" ~ standardized.sentences$if_gb,
                     prob=="p_a_given_nc" ~ standardized.sentences$if_ngb,
                     prob=="p_nc_given_a" ~ standardized.sentences$if_bng,
                     prob=="p_nc_given_na" ~ standardized.sentences$if_nbng,
                     prob=="p_na_given_c" ~ standardized.sentences$if_gnb,
                     prob=="p_na_given_nc" ~ standardized.sentences$if_ngnb,
                     prob=="p_likely_a" ~ "blue might fall",
                     prob=="p_likely_na" ~ "blue might not fall",
                     prob=="p_likely_c" ~ "green might fall",
                     prob=="p_likely_nc" ~ "green might not fall",
                     TRUE ~ NA_character_)
         )

exp1.human = prior_responses %>% select(-group, -n, -prob) %>%
  rename(human_exp1=val, stimulus_id=id)
exp2.human = df.production %>% select(prolific_id, id, response) %>%
  rename(stimulus_id=id, utterance=response) %>% add_column(human_exp2=1)
joint.human = left_join(exp1.human, exp2.human,
                        by=c("prolific_id", "stimulus_id", "utterance")) %>%
  filter(stimulus_id != "ind2")
```

Literal meaning probabilities for responses that each participant gave in
respective trial, computed from participants' ratings in prior-elicitation task
(exp1) plotted separately for each participant. Stimuli are color coded.
When participants said 'X might/might not fall', it is checked whether the
corresponding rated probability is larger than 0.1, if yes, it is set to 1.

```{r}
# 389 test trials (ind2 from training is not in here)
df = left_join(exp1.human,
               exp2.human %>% rename(response=utterance) %>%  
               add_column(human_exp2=1), by=c("stimulus_id", "prolific_id", "response")) %>%
  filter(!is.na(human_exp2)) %>% group_by(stimulus_id) %>%
  mutate(human_exp1=case_when(str_detect(response, "might") & human_exp1>0.1 ~ 1,
                              TRUE ~ human_exp1))
p <- df %>%
    ggplot(aes(y=response, x=human_exp1)) +
    geom_point(aes(color=stimulus_id)) +

    labs(x="rated probability (prior elicitation)", y="response")
```

Quality of the data measured by the squared mean diff of a participant's prior rating to the 
mean of all participants' ratings for the respective probability table cell (of the respective stimulus), summed across all 4 cells for each participant. For each stimulus:
For each cell entry (P(A,C), P(A,Â¬C),..) $c$, compute mean rated probability:
$\mu_c = 1/N \cdot \sum_{i=1}^N x_{c,i}$.

That is, we get one value for each participant and stimulus. For participant i and 
a particular stimulus:
$\sum_{c=1}^{c=4}(x_{c,i} - \mu_c)^2$

jittered points are from those who gave at least one false response in color questions.
```{r}
df =  data.prior %>% responsesSquaredDiff2Mean() %>%
  mutate(stimulus_id=factor(stimulus_id))
df.colored = df %>%
  mutate(colored=prolific_id %in% pids.false_colors) %>% filter(colored==TRUE)

p = df %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=stimulus_id,  y=sum_sq_diff)) +
    geom_boxplot(aes(colour=stimulus_id), outlier.shape=NA) +
    geom_jitter(data=df.colored, aes(colour=stimulus_id), height=0, width=0.05, alpha=0.4, size=1.5) +
    theme_bw(base_size = 20) +
    theme(axis.text.x=element_text(angle=90, vjust=0.5), legend.position="none")
p
ggsave(paste(PLOT.dir, "quality-check-sq-diff.png", sep=SEP), p, width=15, height=10)
```

```{r, echo=FALSE, fig.height = 12}
df.production.means = df.production %>%
  group_by(id,response) %>%
  select(id, response, prolific_id) %>% summarize(n=n(), .groups="drop_last") %>%
  mutate(N=sum(n), ratio=n/N) %>% 
  select(id, response, ratio) %>%

  mutate(response=as_factor(response))

  geom_bar(aes(fill=id), stat="identity") +
  theme_bw(base_size=18) +
  theme(legend.position = "none") +
  facet_wrap(~id)
```

Check whether many participants used all-or-none responses (0-0.5-1)

```{r, all-none-responses, include=FALSE}
# which stimuli were rated as all-or-none by how many participants?
df.all = data.prior.norm %>% group_by(prolific_id, id)

df <- df.all %>% summarise(n=max(response), .groups="drop_last")
df1 = df %>% mutate(id=factor(id, levels=c(IDS, "ind2"))) %>%
  filter(n==1)
ratio.one = nrow(df1) / nrow(df)
print(paste('ratio 1-0-0-0 answers', round(ratio.one,3)))

df05 = df.all %>% mutate(undecided=response>0.2 & response<=0.3) %>%
  filter(undecided==TRUE)
ratio.point5 = nrow(df05) / nrow(df.all)
print(paste('ratio roughly .25-.25-.25-.25 answers', round(ratio.point5, 3)))
```
